intro: Pedicularis husainiana, commonly known as the Kashmir Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, characterized by its parasitic or hemiparasitic nature. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
